abstract: A French regulatory agency said Microsoft’s Skype unit had failed to register as a telecommunications operator as required by law.
snippet: A French regulatory agency said Microsoft’s Skype unit had failed to register as a telecommunications operator as required by law.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — French regulators said Tuesday that they had asked prosecutors to investigate Microsoft’s Skype unit over its failure to register as a telecommunications operator in accordance with local law, raising the question of what constitutes a telephone company in the age of Internet-based communications.

headline.main: Is Skype a Telephone Operator? France Will Investigate
headline.print_headline: French Regulators Seek Inquiry Into Skype

abstract: The Serious Fraud Office of Britain cautioned that it first needed to make sure that its use of an Autonomy product did not pose a conflict of interest for an investigation into its sale to Hewlett-Packard.
snippet: The Serious Fraud Office of Britain cautioned that it first needed to make sure that its use of an Autonomy product did not pose a conflict of interest for an investigation into its sale to Hewlett-Packard.
lead_paragraph: Presumably, the antitrust investigators who looked at Microsoft back in the day had Windows software on their own computers. One could imagine that the prosecutors who brought accounting fraud cases against WorldCom executives might have used its MCI long-distance service. And any number of regulators around the world are likely to have used Google for personal and professional reasons.

headline.main: One Possible Hitch to an Autonomy Investigation
